SEARCH

Class Parser

java.lang.Object
Parser
public class Parser extends Object
Parser for PascalMaisPresque. The parser implements a recursive descend mimicking the run of the pushdown automaton: the call stack replacing the automaton stack.

  • Field Details

    • scanner

      private LexicalAnalyzer scanner
      Lexer object for the parsed file.

    • current

      private Symbol current
      Current symbol at the head of the word to be read. This corresponds to the look-ahead (of length 1).

    • fullRuleDisplay

      private boolean fullRuleDisplay
      Option to print only the rule number (false) or the full rule (true).

    • widestNonTerm

      private static final int widestNonTerm
      Width (in characters) of the widest left handside in a production rule.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • log10ruleCard

      private static final int log10ruleCard
      Width (in characters) of the highest rule number.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • Parser

      public Parser(FileReader source) throws IOException
      Creates a Parser object for the provided file and initialized the look-ahead.
      Parameters:
      source - a FileReader object for the parsed file.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).

  • Method Details

    • multispace

      private static String multispace(int n)
      Returns a string of several spaces.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of spaces.
      Returns:
      a String containing n spaces.

    • ruleOutput

      private static void ruleOutput(int rNum, String ruleLhs, String ruleRhs, boolean full)
      Outputs the rule used in the LL descent.
      Parameters:
      rNum - the rule number.
      ruleLhs - the left hand-side of the rule as a String.
      ruleRhs - the right hand-side of the rule as a String.
      full - a boolean specifying whether to write only the rule number (false) or the full rule (true).

    • ruleOutput

      private void ruleOutput(int rNum, String ruleLhs, String ruleRhs)
      Outputs the rule used in the LL descent, using the fullRuleDisplay value to set the option of full display or not.
      Parameters:
      rNum - the rule number.
      ruleLhs - the left hand-side of the rule as a String.
      ruleRhs - the right hand-side of the rule as a String.

    • displayFullRules

      public void displayFullRules()
      Sets the display option to "Full rules".

    • displayRuleNumbers

      public void displayRuleNumbers()
      Sets the display option to "Rule numbers only".

    • consume

      private void consume() throws IOException
      Advances in the input stream, consuming one token.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).

    • match

      private ParseTree match(LexicalUnit token) throws IOException, ParseException
      Matches a (terminal) token from the head of the word.
      Parameters:
      token - then LexicalUnit (terminal) to be matched.
      Returns:
      a ParseTree made of a single leaf (the matched terminal).
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
      ParseException - in case the matching fails (syntax error): the next tolen is not the one to be matched.

    • parse

      public ParseTree parse() throws IOException, ParseException
      Parses the file.
      Returns:
      a ParseTree containing the parsed file structured by the grammar rules.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
      ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

    • program

      private ParseTree program() throws IOException, ParseException
      Treats a <Program> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply rule [1] <Program> → begin <Code> end
      Returns:
      a ParseTree with a <Program> non-terminal at the root.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
      ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

    • code

      private ParseTree code() throws IOException, ParseException
      Treats a <Code> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
      • [2] <Code> → <InstList>
      • [3] <Code> → ε
      Returns:
      a ParseTree with a <Code> non-terminal at the root.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
      ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      Returns:
      a ParseTree with a <InstList> non-terminal at the root.
      Throws:
      IOException - in case the lexing fails (syntax error).
      ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).

      private ParseTree instruction() throws IOException, ParseException
      Treats a <Instruction> at the top of the stack. Tries to apply one of the rules
      • [7] <Instruction> → <Assign>
      • [8] <Instruction> → <If>
      • [9] <Instruction> → <While>
      • [10] <Instruction> → <Print>
      • [11] <Instruction> → <Read>
      • [12] <Instruction> → begin <InstList> end
      Returns:

      Throws:

      ParseException - in case the parsing fails (syntax error).
